src.inference.backends package¶

Module contents¶

Reusable inference backends.

  • HFBackend wraps transformers AutoModelForCausalLM generate.

  • AzureBackend wraps the Azure OpenAI Responses / Chat Completions client.

These keep model plumbing out of the task/routing logic so scripts can share one uniform interface for “give me generations for these prompts”.

class src.inference.backends.AzureBackend(client: Any, deployment: str, uses_v1: bool)[source]¶

Bases: object

Backend that wraps an Azure/OpenAI client for chat-style generation.

classmethod from_env(deployment: str | None = None) → AzureBackend[source]¶

Construct an AzureBackend using environment / YAML configuration.

The optional deployment parameter overrides the configured deployment name if provided.

Parameters:

deployment – Optional deployment name to use instead of the default.

Returns:

An AzureBackend instance using the configured client.

Raises:

RuntimeError – If Azure configuration helpers are not available.

generate(batch_messages: List[List[Dict[str, str]]], *, temperature: float = 0.0, top_p: float | None = None, max_output_tokens: int = 900) → AzureGenerateResult[source]¶

Generate responses for a batch of message lists.

Parameters:

  • batch_messages – List of chat histories, one per request.

  • temperature – Sampling temperature for the model.

  • top_p – Optional nucleus-sampling parameter.

  • max_output_tokens – Maximum number of tokens to generate.

Returns:

AzureGenerateResult with texts, finish reasons, and raw responses.

class src.inference.backends.AzureGenerateResult(texts: List[str], finish_reasons: List[str], raw: List[Any])[source]¶

Bases: object

Container for batched Azure generation outputs.

Parameters:

  • texts – Decoded text outputs for each request.

  • finish_reasons – Finish reasons reported by the API per request.

  • raw – Raw SDK response objects for each request.

finish_reasons: List[str]¶
raw: List[Any]¶
texts: List[str]¶
class src.inference.backends.HFBackend(tokenizer, model)[source]¶

Bases: object

Backend that wraps a transformers AutoModelForCausalLM and tokenizer.

Instances expose a simple generate method that accepts a list of string prompts and returns decoded texts plus stop reasons.

classmethod from_pretrained(model_name_or_path: str, *, tokenizer_path: str | None = None, load_config: HFBackendLoadConfig | None = None, **load_kwargs) → HFBackend[source]¶

Load a tokenizer and causal LM from HuggingFace and wrap them in HFBackend.

Parameters:

  • model_name_or_path – Name or path of the model to load.

  • tokenizer_path – Optional alternate path or identifier for the tokenizer.

  • load_config – Optional structured configuration for model/tokenizer loading.

  • load_kwargs – Legacy keyword overrides (for example dtype, device_map).

Returns:

An HFBackend instance ready for generation.

generate(prompts: List[str], *, stop_strings: List[str] | None = None, max_length: int | None = None, **gen_kwargs) → HFGenerateResult[source]¶

Generate continuations for a batch of string prompts.

Parameters:

  • prompts – List of input prompt strings.

  • stop_strings – Optional list of string triggers to stop generation.

  • max_length – Optional maximum sequence length for tokenization.

  • gen_kwargs – Additional keyword arguments forwarded to model.generate.

Returns:

HFGenerateResult containing decoded texts and metadata.

class src.inference.backends.HFBackendLoadConfig(revision: str | None = None, cache_dir: str | None = None, dtype: str = 'float16', device_map: str = 'auto', attn_implementation: str | None = None, trust_remote_code: bool = True)[source]¶

Bases: object

Model/tokenizer load configuration for HFBackend.

Grouped to keep helper signatures small for linting while preserving clarity.

attn_implementation: str | None = None¶
cache_dir: str | None = None¶
device_map: str = 'auto'¶
dtype: str = 'float16'¶
revision: str | None = None¶
trust_remote_code: bool = True¶
class src.inference.backends.HFDecodeContext(tokenizer: Any, model: Any, sequences: Any, input_lengths: Any, stop_strings: List[str], max_new_tokens: int | None)[source]¶

Bases: object

Bundle decode-and-classify inputs to keep helper signature small.

Parameters:

  • tokenizer – Tokenizer used to decode generated IDs into text.

  • model – Model instance exposing a config.eos_token_id attribute.

  • sequences – Tensor of generated token IDs.

  • input_lengths – Per-row input lengths used to trim prefixes.

  • stop_strings – List of strings used to detect manual stopping.

  • max_new_tokens – Optional cap on new tokens, used to detect max-length stops.

input_lengths: Any¶
max_new_tokens: int | None¶
model: Any¶
sequences: Any¶
stop_strings: List[str]¶
tokenizer: Any¶
class src.inference.backends.HFGenerateResult(texts: List[str], stop_reasons: List[str], sequences: Any, output: Any)[source]¶

Bases: object

Container for HuggingFace generate() outputs.

Parameters:

  • texts – Decoded text outputs for each generated row.

  • stop_reasons – Human-readable stop reasons per row.

  • sequences – Tensor of generated token IDs.

  • output – Raw object returned by model.generate.

output: Any¶
sequences: Any¶
stop_reasons: List[str]¶
